Looking to escape from Nagpur to the serene beauty of Kashmir? Our detailed tour package offers a seamless blend of majestic landscapes, rich culture, and thrilling adventures. Whether you prefer flying, taking a train, or driving, we’ve got all the options covered for a smooth journey.

Why Choose Kashmir for Your Next Vacation?

Kashmir, often called “Heaven on Earth,” boasts stunning landscapes of snow-capped mountains, lush valleys, and shimmering lakes. It’s not just a visual delight but also a haven for peace and adventure. The region’s vibrant culture and warm hospitality make it a perfect getaway for relaxation and excitement.

For those planning a Kashmir Vacation from Nagpur, this region promises an unforgettable experience when you are looking for a family, adventure, honeymoon or a romantic package from Nagpur.

Highlights of Our Kashmir Tour Packages from Nagpur: Flexible Transportation Options

Traveling from Nagpur (a city in Maharashtra) to Kashmir (the northernmost region of India) is an exciting journey that offers a mix of landscapes, climates, and cultural experiences. Here’s a guide on how to make this journey:

1.By Air:

The quickest and most convenient way to travel from Nagpur to Kashmir is by flight.

  • Step 1: Fly from Nagpur to Srinagar (the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir). There are no direct flights, so you’ll likely have a layover in Delhi or Mumbai.
  • Duration: Approximately 6 to 9 hours (including layover time).
  • Airlines: Major airlines like Air India, IndiGo, Vistara, and GoAir operate this route.
  • Booking Links
    • IndiGo
    • SpiceJet
    • GoAir
    • Air India

2.By Train & Road

If you prefer a more scenic or economical option, traveling by train and road is another possibility.

  • Step 1: Take a train from Nagpur to Jammu Tawi (the nearest major railway station to Kashmir).
    • Popular trains: Jammu Tawi Express, Himsagar Express.
    • Duration: 24 to 30 hours depending on the train.
  • Step 2: From Jammu, take a bus, taxi, or private vehicle to Srinagar.
    • The distance from Jammu to Srinagar is about 260 km, and the drive takes 8 to 10 hours through the scenic Banihal Pass and Jawahar Tunnel.
  • Booking Links
    • Indian Railways
    • Redbus

3.By Road

For adventurous travelers, a full road trip is also an option.

  • Route: Nagpur → Delhi → Chandigarh → Jammu → Srinagar.
  • Distance: Approximately 2,000 km.
  • Duration: Around 3 to 4 days, depending on stops and driving speed.
  • Booking Links for Taxis and Buses
    • Redbus

Best Time to Visit:

· Summer (April to June): Pleasant weather, ideal for sightseeing and exploring the valleys.

· Autumn (September to November): Stunning landscapes with golden hues, perfect for photography and nature lovers.

· Winter (December to February): Snow-covered landscapes, great for skiing and snow activities, especially in Gulmarg.

Our Detailed Itinerary

Day 1: Arrival in Srinagar

  • Welcome at Srinagar Airport
  • Transfer to a luxurious houseboat on Dal Lake
  • Evening Shikara ride on the lake
  • Overnight stay in the houseboat

Day 2: Srinagar City Tour

  • Visit the famous Mughal Gardens: Shalimar Bagh, Nishat Bagh, and Chashme Shahi
  • Tour the old city and explore local crafts markets
  • Overnight in Srinagar hotel

Day 3: Excursion to Gulmarg

  • Scenic drive to Gulmarg known for its beautiful landscapes and ski resorts
  • Gondola ride to Apharwat Peak
  • Optional skiing or snowboarding
  • Return to Srinagar for the night

Day 4: Pahalgam Sightseeing

  • Drive to Pahalgam, a picturesque town on the Lidder River
  • Visit local sites like Betaab Valley and Aru Valley
  • Enjoy local activities like horse riding or trekking
  • Stay overnight in Pahalgam

Day 5: Visit to Sonamarg

  • Day trip to Sonamarg, the “Meadow of Gold”
  • Activities like pony rides to Thajiwas Glacier
  • Return to Srinagar for overnight stay

Day 6: Departure

  • Transfer to the airport for your return flight to Nagpur

FAQs

What is the best time to visit Kashmir for adventure activities?

The ideal time to visit Kashmir for adventure activities is from March to October for summer activities and December to February for winter sports.

Are there any safety precautions for adventure activities in Kashmir?

Yes, it is essential to follow safety guidelines provided by instructors and guides, wear appropriate gear, and be aware of weather conditions.

Can beginners try adventure activities in Kashmir?

Absolutely! Kashmir offers a range of activities suitable for beginners, including skiing, trekking, and rafting with professional guidance.

What should I pack for an adventure trip to Kashmir?

Pack appropriate clothing for the season, sturdy shoes, safety gear for specific activities, and essential items like sunscreen, a first-aid kit, and a water bottle.

Are there any restrictions for adventure activities in Kashmir?

Certain activities may have age or health restrictions. It’s best to check with the activity providers for specific requirements.
